item.title: Xbox Year In Review 2024 Unlocked, Shows Your Most-Played Game And Busiest Month
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/xbox-year-in-review-2024-unlocked-shows-your-most-played-game-and-busiest-month/1100-6528235/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Microsoft has shared that the Xbox Year in Review website tool for 2024 is now live. That means you can discover your most-played game of the year, how many hours you spent gaming, and more.

To access your stats, just visit this Xbox website to get started. From there, you will see your most-played game, highlights of the year, and how you stacked up to other players around the world. Microsoft added that there are a few new features for Year in Review, too, including a customized look from your most-played game as well as a Game Pass breakdown.

Diablo IV: Vessel of Hatred Review

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

There is also a special video message from Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer. The Xbox head honcho says that he played Diablo IV and Fallout 76 the most this year, adding that his friends got reinvested in the latter after the Prime Video TV series premiered. They weren't alone, either. The Fallout games saw a massive boost in player numbers in April after the show's success.

Spencer also touches upon the new campaign to remind people Xbox is more than just a console. He believes it's important for people to play where they want to play, whether it's Xbox Series X or mobile. That also may be why Xbox Year in Review breaks down playing time by where you played: console, PC, mobile, and cloud.

The Xbox Year in Review tool has become an annual occurrence for the company, and Sony and Nintendo are expected to provide similar summaries soon. Meanwhile, 2024 isn't over quite yet. For instance, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle highlights a collection of titles on the way for Game Pass this month.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 Release Date Moved Forward Amidst Crowded Release Schedule
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/kingdom-come-deliverance-2-release-date-moved-forward-amidst-crowded-release-schedule/1100-6528231/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Warhorse Studios has announced that Kingdom Come Deliverance 2's release date has been moved forward to February 4, 2025. Additionally, a new story trailer will drop tomorrow, December 5, as well as the PC and console version details.

In a new update video, public relations manager Tobi Stolz-Zwilling revealed the new release date, and that the new story trailer will premiere on tomorrow's PC Gaming Show. Stolz-Zwilling also explained that Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is now in its final stretches of optimization, meaning that the the studio will finally show the PC and console specs for the game.

There will be performance and quality modes for both the PS5 and Xbox Series X|S versions, along with the PS5 version being enhanced on the Pro console.

Big news: Kingdom Come: Deliverance II will arrive at your homes on FEBRUARY 4TH 2025!⚔️
With the release date pushing one week forward, we have a bunch of more exciting news coming in the following days.
Brand new Story trailer drops Tomorrow on December 5.
PC and Console… pic.twitter.com/hfBrQZJyjS

— Warhorse Studios (@WarhorseStudios) December 4, 2024

Stolz-Zwilling was coy about the decision the studio's decision to move the release date forward, only stating, "So you can start 2025 with the best game there is."

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2's original release date was February 11, which was announced after several delays. Warhorse Studios presumably moved the release date forward in order to avoid February 2025's other big releases. These include Assassin's Creed Shadows on February 14, Avowed on February 18, and Monster Hunter Wilds on February 28.

Warhorse Studios isn't the only developer to move a February 2025 release date forward. Sega's Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii was originally slated for a February 28 release, but was pushed up to February 21.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Get A Closer Look At The Doppelghast Enemy In CoD: Black Ops 6 Zombies
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/get-a-closer-look-at-the-doppelghast-enemy-in-cod-black-ops-6-zombies/1100-6528232/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Citadelle des Morts is a new Zombies map arriving in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 on December 5, and Treyarch has released a short video to give players a behind-the-scenes look at the making of the French-inspired location. The video discusses the design choices and gives a better glimpse at the new Doppelghast enemy type.

Citadelle des Morts is a castle in France overrun with the undead. Treyarch says Zombies mode has plenty of maps "grounded in science fiction," and for this map, it wanted to lean more into magic. Citadelle des Morts also features elemental sword Wonder Weapons. This sounds similar to Black Ops 3's Der Eisendrache map, which was a snowy castle map with elemental bows. However, Treyarch says it has never featured a castle like Citadelle des Morts, as this new design lets players travel further into the claustrophobic bowels of the castle.

Treyarch also pulls back the curtain on the making of the Doppelghast, which is the map's unique special enemy. This creature has two heads and tentacle-like appendages instead of arms, and the developer says it wanted to design the enemy to be as unsettling as possible. The Doppelghast is also described as being "super fast and in your face," and the creature's hasty movement can be seen in the video above.

"We wanted to make it have a diverse attitude, where the two heads are constantly looking for something, but they have a separate mind," says Anthony Dicenzo, who is Treyarch's lead animator for Zombies.

The video also shows off more of the map's unique traps that are designed around the castle theme. This includes hot oil traps that can be lit on fire and magical runes that help protect players.

Treyarch says players will have secrets to uncover within the castle when the map goes live. This will include the main storyline Easter egg quest, but if Citadelle des Morts is anything like the previous two maps, there will likely be plenty of side quests to discover as well.

Additionally, Citadelle des Morts's story trailer can be seen here. This map's narrative merges storylines from Treyarch's previously unconnected Zombies storylines.

All of the highlights of the Season 1 Reloaded update can be found here, which includes new multiplayer maps and new DLC weapons, as well as festive events for both Black Ops 6 and Warzone.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Bleach Rebirth Of Souls Preorders Are $40 At Amazon, But Likely Not For Long
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/bleach-rebirth-of-souls-preorders-are-40-at-amazon-but-likely-not-for-long/1100-6528230/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Bleach Rebirth of Souls preorders are now live at Amazon, seemingly for the wrong price. The PS5 and Xbox Series X editions of the upcoming 3D fighting game are available to preorder for $40 from Amazon. The digital version costs $60 on the PlayStation Store, Xbox Store, and Steam, so Amazon's $40 price likely won't be available for long. Of course, there's a chance Amazon will cancel preorders placed at the $40 price.

Bleach Rebirth of Souls releases March 21, 2025, on PS5, Xbox Series X |S, and PC. Based on the popular anime, this latest entry in the Bleach series is a fast-paced 3D fighting game with swordfighting combat.

Developed by Tamsoft Corporation and published by Bandai Namco, Rebirth of Souls has local and online multiplayer as well as a single-player campaign designed for both veterans and series newcomers. The story is a retelling of the manga and anime from the beginning, so no prior knowledge of Bleach will be needed to follow along.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: The New MSI Claw 8-Inch Handheld Has 32GB RAM, A Faster Processor, And More Upgrades
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-new-msi-claw-8-inch-handheld-has-32gb-ram-a-faster-processor-and-more-upgrades/1100-6528221/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

MSI has revealed new versions of its Claw handheld gaming PC, which will be available in seven- and eight-inch models. Pricing starts at $799 for the Claw 7 AI+ and $899 for the Claw 8 AI+.

The new MSI Claws will feature several upgrades when compared to its predecessor, like bigger batteries, tweaks to its ergonomic design, and Intel's new Lunar Lake Core Ultra 7 processors. These will also be Copilot+ PC-capable handhelds, hence the AI label. RAM has been doubled for the new models, as these have 32GB each, and the CPU speed has increased to 2.2GHz. The original MSI Claw had a 1.2GHz CPU on its Ultra 5 base model, while the Ultra 7 version had a 1.4GHz CPU.

Another big change is the look of the MSI Claw, as you'll be able to pick one up that sports khaki-colored panels. MSI says this design was inspired by wind-sculpted desert rocks, but if you'd prefer something plainer, these will be available in black as well.

The sticks, bumpers, D-pad, and the Hall Effect triggers have received a redesign to allow for more accurate button presses, and MSI says that both of the Claws are equipped with a 120Hz VRR LCD display with an improved resolution of 1920 x 1200.

The Claw 8 has an 80-watt-hour battery--a sizable increase compared to the 53-watt-hour battery from the first model--while the Claw 7 is equipped with a 54.5-watt-hour battery. Here's a closer look at the specs on each one.

MSI Claw 8 AI+

  • Processor: Intel Core Ultra 7 processor 258V
  • Operating System: Windows 11 Home
  • Storage: 1TB
  • Chipset: Integrated SoC
  • Memory: 32GB
  • Display: 8-inch FHD+ (1920 x 1200), 16:10, Touchscreen, 120Hz Refresh Rate
  • Graphics: Intel Arc 140V GPU
  • Storage Slot: Up to 1TB PCIe Gen4 SSD Easy-Access
  • Sensor: 6-axis IMU, vibration motor
  • Audio: 2 x 2W Speakers
  • Dimensions: 299 (W) x 126 (D) x 24 (H) mm
  • Weight: 795 grams

MSI Claw 7 AI+

  • Processor: Intel Core Ultra 7 processor 258VV
  • Operating System: Windows 11 Home
  • Storage: 512GB
  • Chipset: Integrated SoC
  • Memory: 32GB
  • Display: 7" FHD (1920 x 1080), Touchscreen, 120Hz Refresh Rate
  • Graphics: Intel Arc 140V GPU
  • Storage Slot: 1 x NVMe M.2 2230 SSD by PCIe Gen 4 x4
  • Sensor: 6-axis IMU, vibration motor
  • Audio: 2x 2W Speakers, DTS sound effects, support Hi-Res Audio
  • Dimensions: 290 (W) x 117 (D) x 21.2 (H) mm
  • Weight: 675 grams

The first iteration of the MSI Claw launched to lukewarm reviews earlier this year. While it was praised for its excellent speakers and comfortable design, critics noted that it had a weak battery life and poor performance, especially when compared to rivals in the Windows handheld gaming PC space.

If these are drawbacks you can live with, you can pick up an MSI Claw at a decent price right now. Amazon is offering the MSI Claw with 16GB of RAM and an Intel Core Ultra 7 processor for $500 (was $749), or you can get one with an Intel Ultra Core 5 processor for $430 (was $699).

Windows handheld gaming PCs on sale

  • MSI Claw (Intel Core Ultra 5) -- $430 ($699)
  • MSI Claw (Intel Core Ultra 7) -- $500 ($749)
  • Asus ROG Ally Z1 -- $400 ($500)
  • Asus ROG Ally X (2TB) -- $900
  • Lenovo Legion Go -- $540 ($700)

While they're a little pricier, the Asus ROG Ally and Lenovo Legion Go offer a better experience overall. The 2023 Asus ROG Ally Z1 is on sale for $400 at Walmart, and this is a pretty good device for enjoying indie and AA games. It'll still play AAA games if you're willing to make quite a few graphical concessions, but you'll want to consider getting the Z1 Extreme model or the newer ROG Ally X model instead if you want high-end gaming on the go. Both models have the same Z1 Extreme chipset, but you can get a version of the ROG Ally X that has 2TB of storage capacity.

The Legion Go is also recommended, and you can pick one up at the very good price of $540 currently. Normally $700, it's equipped with an AMD Ryzen Z1 Extreme processor, Radeon 700M Series GPU, 16GB of RAM, 512GB SSD, and a massive 8.8-inch display that supports a 144Hz refresh rate and a 2560 x 1600 resolution.

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: New PS5 Update Out Now, Here's What It Does
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/new-ps5-update-out-now-heres-what-it-does/1100-6528226/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The latest PlayStation 5 firmware update has landed, and while it doesn't have any massive new features or improvements, the update has some notable and useful inclusions.

First off, the update improves the data-transfer process from another PS5. Additionally, the update includes "enhanced stability" for large file transfers like video capture. Additionally, the new PS5 update improves "usability" on some screens, and makes some improvements to messages that may appear.

You can see the full patch notes below for the December 4 PS5 firmware update, as shared on Sony's website.

In other PlayStation news, December's PlayStation Plus Essential titles came out on December 3, including It Takes Two and Aliens: Dark Descent, among others. Additionally, Sony just announced a free Gran Turismo game, and it's launching very soon.

It's also the 30th anniversary of PlayStation this week, and to celebrate, Sony released retro PS5 themes and kicked off a huge game sale.

Version: 24.08-10.40.00

  • We've improved the process of transferring data from another PS5 and enhanced stability when transferring large amounts of data, such as captures.
  • We've improved the messages and usability on some screens.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
